widgets_values: You can use same models as you use for inference in Comfy. When fp8_base is enabled, the model is downcasted to torch.float_e4m3fn on initialize, meaning if you load fp8 model here it should also be in same format.
Validation sampling settings are set here for all the sampler nodes.
sanity check that all the args are chosen correctly

For multiresolution training, input same source directory with different dataset resolution. From what I hear, Flux likes multiple resolutions.

For single resolution training, just add single dataset.
high quality, a girl in her twenties, shoulder-length straight pink hair, solo, half-body

output dir:

On the RunComfy platform, you can choose output/{file_name} as the location for your output. 

Once the training is complete, you will be able to view it in the file browser.

IMPORTANT 

Dataset Path:
When using RunComfys file browser, place the training data in the input/{file-name} directory.

Class Token:
If your dataset benefits from using specific class tokens or trigger words, you can enter them in the `class_tokens` parameter.
